frame.name: Giving
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Donor</fen> transfers a <fen>Theme</fen> from a <fen>Donor</fen> to a <fen>Recipient</fen>. This frame includes only actions that are initiated by the <fen>Donor</fen> (the one that starts out owning the <fen>Theme</fen>). Sentences (even metaphorical ones) must meet the following entailments: the <fen>Donor</fen> first has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>. Following the transfer the <fen>Donor</fen> no longer has the <fen>Theme</fen> and the <fen>Recipient</fen> does. <ex><fex name="Donor">Barney</fex> <t>gave</t> <fex name="Theme">the beer</fex> <fex name="Recipient">to Moe</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Theme">$300</fex> was <t>endowed</t> <fex name="Recipient">to the university</fex> <fex name="Purpose">to build a new performing arts building</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Donor
FE.definition: <def-root>The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .</def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for which the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the manner in which the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> are the conditions under which the <fen>Theme</fen> is given. <ex><fex name="Donor">I</fex> <t>give</t> <fex name="Theme">my services</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">free of charge</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Imposed_purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Recipient</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Theme</fen>. <ex>Please <t>give</t> this list to the secretary <fex name="Imposed_purpose">for entry into the client database</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of the <fen>Donor</fen>, <fen>Recipient</fen>, or <fen>Theme</fen> given independently of the giving event per se.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: give.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: freely transfer the possession of; cause to receive or have.

lexUnit.name: donate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give (money or goods) for a good cause

lexUnit.name: donation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: something that is given to a charity, especially a sum of money.

lexUnit.name: donor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who donates something.

lexUnit.name: foist.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: impose an unwelcome or unnecessary person or thing on.

lexUnit.name: endow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give or bequeath an income or property to.

lexUnit.name: pass.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: transfer (something) to someone, especially by handing or bequeathing it to the next person in a series

lexUnit.name: fob off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give (something inferior) to.

lexUnit.name: give out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give freely (to a large number of recipients).

lexUnit.name: hand over.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: hand to someone else

lexUnit.name: hand out.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: distribute something among a group of people

lexUnit.name: gift.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give as a gift, especially formally.

lexUnit.name: gift.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thing given willingly to someone without payment; a present.

lexUnit.name: pass out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: distribute something among a group

lexUnit.name: bequeath.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: leave (property) to a person or other beneficiary by a will.

lexUnit.name: treat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: provide someone with (food, drink, or entertainment) at one's expense

lexUnit.name: hand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pick (something) up and give it to (someone).

lexUnit.name: hand in.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give to an authority in accordance with obligation

lexUnit.name: contribute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give in order to help achieve or provide something.

lexUnit.name: contribution.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: something that is given towards an effort or cause

lexUnit.name: charity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a gift to or the act of giving to another

lexUnit.name: volunteer.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give something to a recipient in need

lexUnit.name: will.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bequeath to someone according to one's written will

lexUnit.name: leave.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bequeath

lexUnit.name: advance.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give earlier than scheduled

lexUnit.name: confer (upon).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: provide (something beneficial, us. a property); NB: only usable when some aspect of the situation (the entity conferred or the recipient) is abstract.

lexUnit.name: bequest.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: entity given by a deceased person upon their death.
